summary: This bill, the "Improving Law Enforcement Officer Safety and Wellness Through Data Act," mandates the Attorney General to produce reports on violence against law enforcement officers. It requires analyses of attacks, training programs, data collection, and mental health resources for officers. The bill aims to improve data collection on violent incidents, assess the effectiveness of existing programs, and provide recommendations for bettering officer safety and well-being, specifically in dealing with ambushes and trauma-inducing events. It also examines the use of existing grant programs like the Bulletproof Vest Partnership.
